content.description:
Somewhat desperate start leads to fun hand jam sequence ending with an even more desperate bulge move before the anchor

Far left line, distinct bulge at the top
4 bolts, chains

Climb a low 5th ramp to a ledge shared with "The Last Line", the easier line to the left. Reach out and clip your first bolt. Chalk up, exhale, go. Climb using the left side of the hueco and holds to its left (clip your second bolt from the hueco or if the draw is there already, the hold below), throw a mean drop knee, keep some body tension and grab a 5 star undercling at the top of the hueco leading you into a beautiful cross move (5.10+) to a heavily chalked hand slot. 

Wow did that ever look cool, sadly that was not the crux. Clip, and power up for a big V3 dead point to turn the lip and clip the chains. 

Fantastic route- the crux is relatively height independent. Whatever reach advantage you have for the dead point is minimized by compressing to get high feet which push you off the wall, no excuses!

Look for the line that goes straight up the left side of the mega roof. The first bolt is high (5 m+), but don't fret, it's easy!
3 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.

Straightforward, low angle climbing on big holds and pockets. Bolts are a bit hidden from the ground. (first bolt ~3m in the alcove)

The line of bolts left of the steep hueco face
5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with chains

Not only is this the Secret Layer must do, this is a Cedar Park must do, especially if you're on a roof tour!

This climb starts up low 5th to a ledge ~5 m off the deck, sharing the first 2 bolts with its neighbor to the left. From the ledge, clip your first bolt (long draw), then pull onto the mega hueco and go! Traverse right and up across the roof past 3 more bolts, before turning the bulge and clipping your 5th and final bolt.

While there is no individual 11+ move, this is a monster overhang that gets to your forearms! Be smart with your feet, and your knees!

Easiest to clean by the first 2-3 bolts from the anchors of the neighboring climb to the left.

The line that cuts obliquely to the right across the mega roof. First bolt down/left of the huge hueco.Â 
5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor
Home of one of the biggest roofs in the park, hosting 2 must do lines on your roof tour! This crag faces SW, getting a brief period of morning shade before unobstructed sunlight until nightfall.
